title: David Beckham ‘emotional’ as kids see his LA Galaxy statue for first time
text:
David’s proud dad moment (Picture: David Beckham, Instagram)

David Beckham had to fight back the tears while taking his children to visit his statue at the LA Galaxy football grounds for the first time.

The retired England footballer took his four children, Brooklyn, 20, Romeo, 17, Cruz, 14, and Harper, eight to the LA Galaxy club’s home at Dignity Heath Sports Park, where his golden statue stands proud and tall.

In a set of Instagram story videos, David and Victoria Beckham’s kids are seen staring at the club’s monument in silence, clearly in awe.

Breaking the silence, David joked: ‘Is my bum big?’ before adding: ‘Your name’s are on the boots as well.’

Brooklyn and Romeo are seen getting a closer look at the statue, before exclaiming: ‘ So cool’ and ‘that’s pretty sick’ respectively.

Romeo also added on Instagram sweetly: ‘So sick ♥️ proud of u dad.’

David, 44, relished in the moment and admitted he was ‘emotional’ alongside a crying gif.

He also wrote alongside an Instagram post of his kids sitting in front of the statue: ‘Very proud moment tonight taking the kiddies to see daddies statue for the first time… @victoriabeckham@brooklynbeckham @romeobeckham@cruzbeckham #HarperSeven.’

LA Galaxy unveiled David’s statue in March to celebrate the six seasons he played with the club and led them to two championships.

David’s statue was unveiled in March (Picture: AFP, Getty Images)

The Late Late Show host James Corden played the ultimate prank on David for his TV show, which saw the former footballer presented with a fake statue that was pretty awful and looked nothing like him.

Looking at the statue in confusion, David said: ‘It’s slightly different than it was when I saw it in Chicago. You know what, the only thing that’s good is the hair. That’s about it. I really don’t see how this can go out.’

Of course, James revealed the prank and the real statue was erected on the grounds.

After taking his brood on the momentous trip to LA Galaxy’s home, David and Victoria treated them to a dinner at Giorgio Baldi in Santa Monica.
